sections.title: Property Transaction Legal Requirements
sections.content: Understanding the legal framework governing real estate transactions is crucial for all parties involved. This section covers the essential legal requirements for property sales, purchases, and transfers.
bullets: Title verification and due diligence processes
Stamp duty and registration fee calculations
Required documentation for different property types

subsections.title: Documentation Requirements
subsections.content: Broker Adda keeps the registration process simple but requires basic documentation to maintain trust and compliance. The requirements differ slightly for Customers and Brokers:
items: For Customers: Basic ID proof (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, or Driving License)
For Customers: Verified mobile number or email via OTP
For Customers: Profile details including name, gender, location, budget, and property preferences
For Brokers: Government ID proof (PAN / Aadhaar)
For Brokers: Address proof (utility bill, Aadhaar, or rental agreement)
For Brokers: Business ID / RERA Registration Number (if applicable)
For Brokers: Company details such as business name, region, and license number
For Brokers: Optional GST Number for invoicing and compliance
For Brokers: Bank details if payouts or subscriptions are involved

subsections.title: Registration Process
subsections.content: Getting started with Broker Adda is simple and quick. The entire signup process is designed to be secure and role-specific for both brokers and customers.
items: Go to the Broker Adda website or app and click 'Sign Up'
Choose your role – Broker or Customer
Enter your mobile number or email and receive an OTP
Verify OTP to confirm your identity
Fill in basic profile details (name, location, preferences, business info for brokers)
Complete registration and access your personalized dashboard
Brokers can start adding leads and properties; customers can browse, shortlist, and connect

complianceChecklist.title: Real Estate Compliance Checklist
complianceChecklist.description: Use this checklist to ensure your real estate transactions meet all legal requirements:

categories.title: Pre-Transaction Compliance
items: Verify property title and ownership
Check for legal encumbrances
Obtain necessary NOCs and clearances
Verify developer's RERA registration
Review all project documentation

categories.title: Transaction Documentation
items: Prepare sale deed with proper clauses
Calculate and pay stamp duty
Arrange for property registration
Obtain tax clearance certificates
Complete all required documentation

categories.title: Post-Transaction Compliance
items: Update property records
Transfer utility connections
File necessary tax returns
Maintain transaction records
Comply with ongoing obligations

regulatoryBodies.title: Key Regulatory Bodies
regulatoryBodies.description: These are the primary regulatory authorities that govern real estate practices in India. Broker Adda aligns with their guidelines to ensure trust, transparency, and compliance.

bodies.name: Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA)
bodies.role: Monitors real estate developers and brokers, ensuring transparency and protecting buyers' interests.

bodies.name: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA)
bodies.role: Responsible for housing policies, real estate reforms, and urban development programs across India.

bodies.name: Income Tax Department
bodies.role: Regulates tax obligations related to property transactions, rental income, and capital gains.

bodies.name: State Revenue & Stamp Duty Departments
bodies.role: Oversee property registration, land records, and collection of stamp duty and registration fees.

bodies.name: Data Protection Authorities
bodies.role: Ensure secure handling of personal and financial data in compliance with privacy laws (like DPDP Act in India).

questions.question: What documents are required to create an account on Broker Adda?
questions.answer: Customers need a basic ID proof (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, or Driving License) along with mobile/email OTP verification. Brokers need to provide additional documents such as business/RERA ID, address proof, and company details.

questions.question: Is RERA registration mandatory for brokers on Broker Adda?
questions.answer: Yes, in states where RERA regulations apply, brokers are required to provide their RERA registration number. This ensures trust and compliance on the platform.

questions.question: Do customers need to complete KYC to browse properties?
questions.answer: No, customers can browse properties after completing basic profile setup and OTP verification. However, ID proof verification is recommended for connecting with brokers and accessing all features.

questions.question: How are documents verified on Broker Adda?
questions.answer: Once documents are uploaded, the Broker Adda compliance team reviews and verifies them. Verification for brokers may take 1–2 working days.

questions.question: Is my data and documentation safe on Broker Adda?
questions.answer: Yes, Broker Adda follows industry-standard data protection practices. All documents are stored securely with encryption and are never shared with third parties without consent.

questions.question: What happens if a broker does not submit documents?
questions.answer: Unverified brokers will have limited access to features. Submitting complete documentation is mandatory for lead transfers, premium listings, and payouts.
